Detailed Description

AppWidgetHost provides the interaction with the AppWidget service for apps, like the home screen, that want to embed AppWidgets in their UI. 

 // Define your AppWidgetHost ID before create an AppWidgetHost instance.
 int32_t mHostID = 1111;

 //Create an AppWidgetHost instance on your AP.
 AppWidgetHost* mpHost = new AppWidgetHost(this, mHostID);

 // Create AppWidgetManager to get all install AppWidgetProviderInfo
 AppWidgetManaget* mpManager = new AppWidgetManager(this);
 Vector<AppWidgetProviderInfo*> instanllObject;
 instanllObject = mpManager->getInstalledProvidersN(AppWidgetProviderInfo::PROVIDER_TYPE_HOME);

 //Get a AppWidgetId for an AppWidget that will be added.
 int32_t mAppWidgetId = mpHost->allocateAppWidgetId()
 //Bind AppWidgetId with corresponding AppWidgetProviderInfo.
 AppWidgetProviderInfo* info = instanllObject.itemAt(i);
 mpManager->bindAppWidgetId(mAppWidgetId, info->getProvider());

 // Create AppWidgetHostWidget with corresponding AppWidgetProviderInfo, and you can add it to WidgetController to display.
 AppWidgetHostWidget* widget = mpHost->createWidgetN(this, mAppWidgetId, info);

 //Start listening your AppWidget when AP go to onStart and onRestart lifecycle.
 mpHost->startListening();

 //Stop listening your AppWidget when AP go to onStop lifecycle.
 mpHost->stopListening();

 //Delete AppWidgetHost when AP go to onTear lifecycle, it will delete all AppWidgetId from AppWidgetService.
 mpHost->deleteHost();

 // If you will customize the AppWidgetHostWidget, you can customize an AppWidgetHost
 // and override onCreateWidget function to return custom subclass.

 class MyAppWidgetHostWidget;
 class MyAppWidgetHost: public gaia::core::AppWidgetHost {
   public:
     MyAppWidgetHost(const gaia::core::Page* page, int32_t hostId);
     virtual ~MyAppWidgetHost();

   protected:
     gaia::core::AppWidgetHostWidget* onCreateWidget(const gaia::core::Page* page, int32_t appWidgetId,
       gaia::core::AppWidgetProviderInfo* appWidget) const {return new MyAppWidgetHostWidget(page);};
 };

You could refer to the development page for AppWidget details: COS Cplusplus Development/Developer Guides/AppWidget

void gaia::core::AppWidgetHost::deleteHost ( )

Remove all records about this host from the AppWidget manager.

Call this when initializing your database, as it might be because of a data wipe. Call this to have the AppWidget manager release all resources associated with your host. Any future calls about this host will cause the records to be re-allocated.

virtual core::AppWidgetHostWidget* gaia::core::AppWidgetHost::onCreateWidget ( const Page *  page,
int32_t  appWidgetId,
core::AppWidgetProviderInfo *  appWidget 
) const [virtual]

Called to create the AppWidgetHostWidget.

Override to return a custom subclass if you need it.

void gaia::core::AppWidgetHost::startListening ( )

Start receiving onAppWidgetChanged calls for your AppWidgets.

Call this when your page becomes visible, i.e. from onStart() and onRestare() in your page.

void gaia::core::AppWidgetHost::stopListening ( )

Stop receiving onAppWidgetChanged calls for your AppWidgets.

Call this when your page is no longer visible, i.e. from onStop() in your page.
